content: The Act titled "Transferring Credits for College Completion Act of 2012" requires data reporting. The Act "Transferring Credits for College Completion Act of 2012" mandates reporting transfer completion data for degree-seeking undergraduate students. The Act "Transferring Credits for College Completion Act of 2012" requires reporting transfer completion data for degree-seeking undergraduate students. This section will take effect one year after the enactment of the Act. SEC. 3. ARTICULATION AGREEMENTS. Transfer of Credit Policies under the Higher Education Act of 1965 are amended to include requirements for institutions to indicate if courses are transferable for credit towards a degree at a public institution of higher education in their course schedules. The Higher Education Act of 1965 is amended to require public institutions of higher education to enter into articulation agreements with common general education core curriculum. The Higher Education Act of 1965 is amended to require public institutions of higher education to enter into articulation agreements for transferable coursework, including common course numbering and guaranteed transfer of associate degrees towards related baccalaureate programs. The Higher Education Act of 1965 now mandates public institutions of higher education to establish articulation agreements for transferable coursework. Tribal Colleges or Universities are exempt from this requirement. The subsection does not authorize the Secretary or the National Advisory Committee to dictate specific policies regarding credit transfer, nor does it allow Department officials to exert control over institutions. The Higher Education Act of 1965 mandates articulation agreements for transferable coursework at public institutions of higher education, excluding Tribal Colleges or Universities. The Act prohibits the Department from controlling curriculum, instruction programs, administration, personnel, accrediting agencies, or student enrollment at higher education institutions. It also does not create legally enforceable rights for students regarding enrollment or credit transfer. The Higher Education Act of 1965 is amended to include requirements for comprehensive articulation agreements at public institutions of higher education. The amendments specify the insertion of certain clauses and the removal of others, with a deadline extension to 2014.
